description.narrative: The objective of the project is to improve the viability and effectiveness of urban services provided by the participating TMAs, and to make such improvements sustainable and replicable in other TMAs through the creation of a performance-based management framework at both TMA and provincial levels.

condition.narrative: Capacity and Development Grants will be designed & implemented according to the procedures laid out in the Operations Manual andESF.
Project will be carried out acording to Operations Manual, Financial Manual and ESF.

title.narrative: % of households connected with water supply system

baseline.value: 40% (average of 11 TMAs with PMSIP water supply sub-projects)

comment.narrative: Baseline and target values updated to 11 TMAs.

actual.value: 53% (average of 11 TMAs with PMSIP water supply

title.narrative: % of solid waste disposed per day at landfill site

baseline.value: 0 (average of 6 TMAs with landfill sites developed under PMSIP sub-projects)

comment.narrative: No landfill site developed under the project was operating in partner TMAs.

actual.value: 74% (average of 6 TMAs with landfill sites developed under PMSIP sub-projects)

title.narrative: Number of TMAs using FMS generated reports for the annual local fund audit.

comment.narrative: This indicator has been added following project restructuring

This indicator has been added following project restructuring.CFMS reports are being generated by 102 TMAs. Office of DG Audit ispreparing for system audit, once Account Rules, Budget Rules, and Rules of Business under PLGA 2013 are operationalized.

title.narrative: Evidence of GoPunjab's improved capacity to monitor TMA performance.

baseline.value: GoPunjab currently has no ability to systematically monitor TMA performance. PMSIP is helping create the capacity in LG&CDD.

target.value: Data Networking and Performance Monitoring System covering all provincial TMAs fully operationalized, and being utilized forcentral policy development and decision-making.

actual.value: Integrated web-based Performance Management System (PMS) and Computerized Financial Management System (CFMS) are fully operationalat 105 and 102 TMAs respectively. An integrated monitoring cell has been created at LG&CDD. This cell is assisting LG&CDD overseeTMA performance on municipal service delivery, performance of TMA staff, and expenditures and financial management.

title.narrative: Evidence of GoPunjab's improved capacity to manage cultural heritage assets

baseline.value: Overlapping institutional mandates and lack of coordination in Punjab make it difficult for GoPunjab to manage cultural heritageassets.

target.value: GoPunjab will have a clear and effective institutional structure and coordination mechanism for cultural heritage asset management.

actual.value: The Walled City of Lahore Authority (WCLA) has been established under the Walled City of Lahore Act 2012 as an autonomous andspecialized institutional entity for conserving the heritage of the Walled City of Lahore, enhancing the quality of life of itsresidents, and the planning and management of infrastructure and services.

title.narrative: Evidence of rising levels of satisfaction among key stakeholder groups with respect to services targeted under the project and improvement in selected service delivery indicators.

target.value: Improvements in TMAs’ key service delivery indicators (refer intermediate outcome indicators).

actual.value: Results from the independent third-party survey of beneficiary perceptions provides strong evidence of the increased satisfactionof beneficiary groups from service delivery improvements under PMSIP: (i) Both quantity and quality of water supplied by TMAs haveimproved or significantly improved;(ii) Investments in roads improved access, travel times, vehicle maintenance costs, fuelconsumption, and business opportunities; and(iii) Improvement in primary collection, transportation, and disposal of solid wastehas improved overall cleanliness of neighborhoods.

title.narrative: Evidence, via reports from independent technical and social audit teams, of improved effectiveness and financial and technical viability of urban services provided by participating TMAs

baseline.value: TMAs in need of improved and well structured management systems for improved service delivery, developmental spending, and revenuegeneration.

target.value: Improved TMA capacity for provision of effective and viable urban services.

actual.value: Findings of the two ID assessments undertaken at MTR and end-of-project stages, as well as the results from intermediate outcomeindicators related to ID activities, provide evidence of increased capacity and performance improvement related to: (i) Monitoringof coverage and quality targets for service delivery; (ii) Registration and resolution of complaints from service consumers; (iii)Financial/ accounting and revenue management systems; (iv) Demand driven development planning; and (v) information disseminationand transparency. Capacity and experience developed at TMAs through delivering infrastructure sub-projects under PMSIP will enableTMAs to effectively manage future service delivery investments.
